cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (90 km) S of the eastern tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to continue WNW across Cuba, then turn northwest and strengthen while tracking through the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast, likely between Morgan City and Lake Charles (near central LA coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Central Bahamas, Andros Island, and the Florida Keys from Ocean Reef to Key West, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Northern Dominican Republic coast from Samana to the Haiti border, entire coast of Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos Islands, and much of the Cuban coastline
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi, including southeast Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible late Wednesday night into Thursday with a 27% cumulative chance of ≥34-kt winds and up to a 6% chance of ≥50-kt winds at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of several feet is possible along the southeast Louisiana coast and lower Mississippi River as Laura approaches, especially if it strengthens into a hurricane before landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 4–8 inches with localized higher amounts possible, producing flash-flood risk around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and brief navigation interruptions due to very rough seas on the lower Mississippi River.
